glosses: Used to add a meaning of curiosity, indecision or doubt, and sometimes courtesy. Roughly equivalent to “I wonder (if/whether)”, “Would you please...”, “May I...”, "by any chance".

examples.translation: I wonder what did he/she buy me as a present?
I wonder if I could pass this exam?/Could I pass this exam?
(I wonder,) which shoe should I buy?

examples.text: Acaba şu çantaya da bakabilir miyim?
examples.translation: Could I see that bag, too, by any chance?

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish عجبا (ʿacaba), from Arabic عَجَبًا (ʕajaban), adverbial accusative of عَجَب (ʕajab, “astonishment, wonder, amazement”).
